headline: Buttermilk Pound Cake
description: This buttermilk pound cake is flavored with lemon and vanilla, then baked until golden for a simple dessert served with fresh berries or ice cream.
name: Buttermilk Pound Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 9- or 10-inch tube pan.
Mix together flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl. Set aside.

Beat together sugar and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at time, beating well after each addition. Stir in lemon and vanilla extracts. Add flour mixture in batches, alternating with buttermilk, beating batter briefly after each addition. Pour batter into the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until cake begins to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 90 minutes; do not open the oven door until after 1 hour. Let cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Extremely easy to make, great flavor

I made this cake yesterday very moist and flavorful, I added a little more vanilla and lemon other than that I used the recipe, DELICIOUS, also added a buttercream icing, next time I'll do chocolate icing. Thanks for the recipe

Great recipe! I wouldn't change a things except the cook time. 50-55 minutes is enough to retain moisture. I also pour in about 2 TBS of sprite or 7 up or sour cream for added moisture. I want to the cake to retain its moisture for a couple of days. Oh this recipe also works with King Arthur Gluten free flour.
Excellent flavor, loved the hint of lemon, I used it for strawberry shortcake & it was a big hit!
This was a big hit for Christmas! My family said it was the best piound cake ever. I am making another one as I type.
Great recipe. I only had to use 1 tsp of grated lime zest to substitute the extract. Forgot to take a picture though. Next time.
No changes it’s cooling smells and looks good
Very happy with this recipe! I substituted the 1 tsp. Of lemon extract with 2.5 Tablespoons of fresh lemon juice that I had leftover in my fridge. Delicious!!!!!!

I just took this cake out of the oven like 15 minutes ago, it smells wonderful and I can’t wait to cut into it. It was done in 75 minutes. I didn’t change the recipe, just the steps. I separated my eggs and beat my egg whites with 3 Tbsp. of the sugar, after I added my extract (oh, I did use all vanilla as my husband doesn’t like lemon, so I guess I did make changes) I folded the egg whites into the batter. My house smells so good!!! I did post a picture of my cake and my cake pan...think I need a new pan.
Recipe was nice and easy, I added Banana flavoring and Omg it is so delicious.
I had some buttermilk that was about to expire, so I started looking up recipes for buttermilk cake. This one stuck out and I’m glad it did. It is delish!
This is an easy pound cake to make, very moist and taste great.
This is a great tasting cake. I followed the directions and the cake was soft and moist and very tasty! Can't wait to make it again!

I substituted 1/2 the butter with Crisco, used fresh lemon juice and zest and added 1 1/2 teas cardamom (thanks for the suggestion) I baked as 2 loaves, 70 min was just right (thanks for the tip). Really great recipe that obviously would be delicious just as written but my Scandinavian heritage forced me to add the cardamom and I was short of butter. I just wanted to confirm the recipe still worked well with the changes I made.

I followed the recipe exactly except I halved it and baked it in a 9x5 loaf pan for 65 minutes. It came out beautifully! Moist, dense, flavorful. Perfect on its own or with a scoop of ice cream or fruit.

Made it exactly how it is written. I lost my old recipe when our home burned down and today I needed a recipe for pound cake to make strawberry short cake and between the 2 that took buttermilk I had all the ingredients for this one and so happy I did. This is excellent and perfect made exactly as is. No need for me to ever try a different recipe.

This is a wonderful pound cake! I made the suggestions KARLMALE made, adding lemon juice and zest along with cardamom, what a wonderful flavor combo!
Make this TODAY!

Amazing! I've made it multiple times. I halved the recipe and put it into a bread loaf pan for an 1 hour and 10 minutes. Instead of lemon extract, I grated lemon zest from a large lemon to get 1 tbsp, it was scrumptious.
We substituted the lemon extract with equal amount of grated lemon zest. Just the right amount of lemon for us.
Great moist cake. I made as is except added blueberries. Wonderfully delicious.
We loved the recipe. I used two standard loaf pans and baked for 55min.
Love the texture but it's too sweet. Will try to do .5 part sugar instead next time and see if that helps. Possibly do .5 of the vanilla extract as well.

I made this cake today using the variation with the zest and juice from one lemon plus 2 t. vanilla and the taste is delicious! I baked it in my Bundt pan. The problem was that it stuck to the pan so bad, even though I had thoroughly greased it, that I was not able to get it out of the pan! I had to cut the cake into four sections to remove it from the pan, I have never had to do that to a cake before!! If I bake it again, it will be in loaf pans.

I, along with many others, hate it when people review a recipe that they did not follow, but instead changed. However, I am guilty of this. I cannot eat gluten, so I made this gluten free. I used Cup 4 Cup premixed all purpose gluten free flour blend, and I also added 1/4 teaspoon of baking powder and around 1/2 cup of sour cream to the cake batter. I baked it at 325 for 77 minutes in a non stick bundt pan. After baking, I let the cake sit for 15 minutes, and it came right out of the pan. Once it was cooled, I made a powdered sugar glaze icing (powdered sugar, milk, vanilla) to drizzle over the cake. It was absolutely perfect! I will make this again and again, thanks for sharing the recipe!
This was easy to make and is absolutely moist and delicious!This is my new favorite pound cake recipe.

It’s about the 10th time I have made this cake. I have gifted it several times. I followed the recipe to the T!! Each time. I have a fast oven so I have adjusted the cooking time. EVERYONE THAT HAS TASTES THIS CAKE !! Asks for the recipe. Or asks me to please bake them one!!!! This Even beats my Mimmie’s pound cake!! And that is saying everything!!!
No changes necessary, moist and delicious
Absolutely Delicious!! Came out perfect! Didn't change anything! Thank You! Will be making it again Saturday and for Christmas!!
I’m no baker or chef, but thought the time was a bit excessive so I only baked for 60 minutes and it came out perfect! I also used vanilla and almond extract instead.

Yum is all I can say! I did everything as written, but used the zest if two lemons and the juice of one and the zest of a tangerine. My family thought it needed even more citrus, so I added the juice of one more lemon and a little more lemon extract. I also added 1/4 cup of sour cream to keep it from being dry. I added a lemon tangerine glaze and it is SO good!
Ine Awesome cake.... a favorite of family and friends when I make it
I love this cake, I will only cook it 2 or 3 times a year because I have high cholesterol…

This is my first ever review. The cake was super easy to make and I really appreciated all the tips in the reviews of others. I used only 5 eggs because I buy extra large eggs. I used 2 tsps of vanilla extract and 1 tsp of lemon extract. I think I could have used 2 tsp and it would have been even better. I’ll probably also try fresh lemons as suggested by others. Thanks to all who gave tips on time to bake so it wasn’t dry. I totally forgot to take a photo and the cake is now completely gone! I’ll update my post with a picture the next time I make this keeper of a recipe.
great
Followed the recipe to the letter. Next time I will grease AND flour the pan.Turned out great.
I loved the flavor of this cake, but it was a bit dense/tight for me. Maybe it just needed more moisture.
Made this for Mother’s Day picnic and it was a huge success! Everyone wanted the recipe. It is moist, slightly tangy and perfect with fresh fruit or plain, breakfast hit too!

I have made this cake for years and have always made the lemon and cardamom suggestion by reviewer karlmale in 2001. Add juice and zest of 1 large lemon - which is about 1/4 c juice, 2 teaspoons vanilla, 1-1/2 tsp cardamom. The only thing I do different is my glaze is 1/2 c powder sugar, 2Tbs cream, 1/4 tsp lemon extract and 1/4 tsp vanilla. Sometimes I just dust with powdered sugar. It has the absolutely best flavor. I made it today and decided to add a rating and review.
I made it and used 1 c brown sugar instead of one of the cups of white sugar as someone suggested. Made it too grainy. I won’t do that again ??
So delicious. Very good. I spread this on sheet pans and made a poke cake out of it. Rich. Dreamy.
Excellent recipe! No changes needed!!
Just like it was growing up in the country on an old dirt road. Small town girl

OK. So this waa my first time making a pound cake and I must say, this came out amazing. I subbed lemon extract for lemon zest and pretty much did everything else down to a T. I was a bit mad because my cake kinda got stuff to the Pan a little but not enough to break the cake. I buttered it well, but should have used my non-stick spray as I usually do when I bake. Also, I did half powered sugar and made an icing using Rumchata for the other half. AMAZING.

I've made this three times. Took others suggestions and added more vanilla - 2 tsp vanilla and 1 tsp almond. This was almost too sweet so the next time I made it I added 1/2 tsp lemon peel. The last time I made it I dropped some blueberries in the batter. That was the perfect balance. If you plan on glazing this, I would back off a little on the sugar.
Followed directions to the T...was a little dry. I’ll keep looking for perfect pound cake recipe. This should include glaze, would’ve made it better.
After my second attempt to bake this cake, I did the thing! I'm just saying!

I've used this recipe to make cup cakes. Only change I made was adding lemon juice rather than extract. Also I probably use more vanilla extract and lemon juice than listed bc I didn't measure. For cupcakes I set the oven for 350 and cooked about 20min (don't quote me on the time). They came out very delicious. Made them for a Christmas party and it hasn't been a week since Christmas and I'm on my second batch for my house. Very important tip for baking...make sure all ingredients are room temp (eggs, buttermilk, butter). If I haven't allowed things to sit out I sit the eggs in warm water and heat the butter and buttermilk in microwave to take the chill off. Make sure you throughly mix in each ingredient.
the best ever pound cake recipe. I make it all the time and it's the family favorite.
It was really dry
Everyone could not stop eating it. It was gone in two days.

It was delicious!!! I cut the recipe in half (bc in only had 1.5c gluten free flour), reduced the sugar by 1/2c and doubled the vanilla, as was suggested by other reviews & it was amazing!!!! I made cupcakes bc I couldn't find the cake pan. They were devoured! I also made a rum buttercream icing to top off the cake. It's definitely a repeat. The cake wasn't too sweet, the flavor was excellent

Best pound cake recipe yet.Texture was perfect.I only use salted butter so I backed off on the salt in the recipe using about 1/2 tsp.instead of the 1tsp.Also omitted lemon and added 1 tsp. butter flavoring and 1/4 tsp Almond extract
This was excellent. I used half brown sugar and added chocolate chips. The chips sunk to the bottom but it still tasted amazing.
It was a yummy light pound cake...took the advise from the other reviews and cooked in loaf pan for 60 minutes, came out pretty good, thanks for this recipe!!

I forced my self to follow the recipe almost exactly, using a cup of soy milk and a teaspoon of lemon juice instead of the buttermilk because I can't have dairy. I will almost definitely make it again, but next time I may add something a bit more daring to the recipe. Thank you for a great cake recipe to add to my collection. I admit I have not tasted it yet, but my sister loves it.

I added mandarin oranges to the batter just before pouring into the pan. Folding them in gently. My friends and family loved the added surprise and asked me to keep it in my "make often" box. *laughs*

Making it again today since it went over so well and I am adding dark chocolate shavings and coconut with diced almonds.
It turn out great! Will make this one again. I did put the glaze over the cake
AWESOME! Minus the lemon & added almond instead + the vanilla extract. Served w/ love & homemade whipped cream, topped w/ blueberries.
I changed the baking time to 1 hr and 9 minutes.
It was very good.

This is a great recipe! I made four mini loafs from this recipe, baking time approx 45min. The only thing I did differently was double the vanilla extract and used some fresh squeezed lemon juice cause that's what I had. I made a topping of sliced strawberries, sugar and lemon juice mixed together and added that on the sliced cake after it was cooled with some whip cream, delicious.

Cake turned out beautiful and moist and disappeared real fast. Only change I made was to add a little nutmeg to recipe and a powder sugar/butter icing to drizzle on cake thinned out with fresh squeezed orange juice instead of water or milk.

the last pound cake i made was sooo dry....but this one...that is not the case at all. The buttermilk makes it so moist and delicious. The cake is very dense but that is what made it perfect for strawberries and whipped cream! Easy to measure out, mix and bake and it only baked in my oven within 45 mins!
It came out beautiful, light and very flavorful. Added a lemon glaze that added to the lemony flavor. Yum!
I followed the recipe with no changes. My family loved it. My dad said don’t make anything else it is his favorite.

This is the pound cake recipe that I've been looking for. This is what I think a pound cake should be like! I followed the example of others and used real lemon juice and zest to make it more like a lemon pound cake. We had it with frozen strawberries and real whipped cream. Excellent!
This pound cake is perfect to eat by itself or to frost with a good lemon icing. Definitely a go to recipe.

I make this pound cake all the time. The texture is exactly what you want in a pound cake- moist & dense & the flavor is perfect. It always bakes in 70 minutes in my oven.The only changes I make are to use almond extract in place of the vanilla and lemon. I also use plain yogurt in place of the buttermilk. (I've made it with buttermilk also & the taste & texture is the same with the yogurt as the buttermilk. I just always have plain yogurt in my fridge.) I like this pound cake best plain but it's good with whipped cream & strawberries, or an almond glaze- even just some butter spread on a piece! Leftover slices of this pound cake freeze really well too.
I made this cake for super bowl and it was a hit! Everyone loved it, very moist and tasteful, going to definitely make it again!
This recipe is awesome, my family and coworkers love it. I’ve made it several times!! Perfection every time. Thank you!
Followed the recipe exactly. Just added a small amount of frozen blueberries to the top before putting it in the oven.

I've made this twice now. It definitely took 90+ minutes for me. My oven is only 2 years old so it should be fairly accurate.

The first time I did it nearly as exactly directed except I used fresh lemon as opposed to lemon extract. I didn't use any glaze or frosting as i actually really like pound cake on its own and wanted to see if this recipe was good on its own. I liked it but my wife said it was moist but didn't taste much lemon. 

So the second time I used an extra tablespoon of vanilla extract and extra tablespoon of fresh lemon juice. This definitely made it much more lemony to the satisfaction of my wife. I also added a lemon glaze and a simple lemon frosting to add more lemon flavor to the final product.
Had a very pleasant taste and got many compliments. I used 1/2 less sugar and it still turned out great . I will make this recipe again.

I followed the advice of KARLMALE and added 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract, 1.5 teaspoons of cardamom and zest of a whole orange and juice of half of a huge orange (I didn't have lemons). I also made glaze by mixing juice from the remaining orange with confectioners sugar. I do think that it is on a sweeter side, I prefer my desert a little less sweet. But I know that most people like it this way. It turned out moist and flavorful. I will be making it again, probably with walnuts next time.
Came out great. I substituted with 1 and 1/2 cups brown sugar and added 2 cups of nuts. I also poked holes and poured over a warm brown sugar sauce. Finally, topped with a vanilla glaze. To die for!
I’m not a baker but this was very easy to make. My second time making it. . It’s a Christmas gift for a friend. Thanks for the recipe!!
Best pound cake I have ever made...will make over and over and over again!
This was sooooo good. Amazingly yummy! I changed nothing except that I didn’t have lemon extract so I left it out. Thanks for the great recipe!

Texture (not too crumbly and not too dense) and flavor was good but waaayy too sweet. Top was crusty and cake was sticky around sides due to too much sugar. Will cut back to 2 1/2 cups sugar next time. Will also flour pan after greasing since cake stuck to it although I used a non-stick Bundt pan and greased it well.

This was my second time creating a pound cake. It was not as successful as my first among my family but it was still pretty good. I followed the directions exactly. When greasing my dish, I also floured it (I have always been told to do that and while I'm not an experienced baker, I did so with this as well.) It still stuck some, I assume this was an error on my end. My biggest issue was the cooking time. I took it out at 70 minutes in and it was already close to overcooked. If I hadn't checked it, I am sure it would have burnt at 90 minutes. May have been my oven but the last one I tried said to come out at 60 minutes and I should have did the same with this one. The buttermilk was a nice change. I like the tartness it provided.

This recipe is the best I've ever used to make pound cake. I've made it several times, following the recipe exactly and also changing it up by using all vanilla extract instead of the lemon. Wonderful flavor, nice crumb, soft texture; you really can't go wrong with this one!

Added 1/2 stick butter and 1/2 cup sour cream. Came out wonderfully! Yum! I believe it would be great as is. Added those per another reviewer's recommendation because I love butter and sour cream. I already had them on hand. Why not?

The grain of this pound cake is exactly what you would want it to be, small and dense. Mine turned out looking exactly like the one in the photo. I think it was a little dry, but perfect for any kind of topping - fruit, ice cream, whipped cream, etc. We ate it plain tonight. I suspect it will get moister upon sitting, so maybe tomorrow it will be perfect. Next time I make it I think I will double the vanilla and leave out the lemon extract.
The only chg I made was, I added rum to the sauce. Just enough to give you a wow factor. It did not damage the integrity of the structure in the cake. Looking forward to the next cake/meal. kj

This makes a perfect layer cake-no need to trim off any cake as the layers bake evenly. I just used two teaspoons of vanilla for a nice neutral base. One recipe made three 8" round layers (2" high). I also tried making these into cupcakes, but it didn't work out.
Love this pound cake.
Very simple, but great tasting pound cake. Most and delicious, family loved it. Thanks

I have a question. Recipe says not to open oven door for one hour. Is that one hour after it finishes baking, or one hour after you put it in the oven? Although this is just a question, I had to select a star rating. I'm hoping this tastes like the buttermilk pound cake my mother used to make. Thanks!

Okay- tech issues :) - As I was saying, I'd made this recipe for a potluck, and it was a huge hit! I took pieces of suggestions from other reviews and I think it made for a winning cake. Here are the tweaks I made: I used the zest and juice of one lemon; I added 2t of vanilla; i added 1/2 c of sour cream; added 1 1/2t of ground cardamom(the wow factor!); and I used five whole eggs and one egg YOLK. The cake was so moist and flavorful! I also baked it for almost 90mins at the stated temp and used a 12in tube-pan. I did beat the butter and sugar for a good five minutes.
So good!

I was looking for a cake recipe to serve with strawberries on Memorial day. I was especially looking for cake because my son is not wild about the biscuit type shortcake. This is the best pound cake I've ever eaten. Everybody raved about it. It did not disappoint. Thank you for a great recipe.
I made it for Mothers Day. My family really enjoyed the cake and I made an extra one for a friend who really enjoyed. I will make it again.

This turned out pretty good! I added some rhubarb (cooked with a bit of sugar, butter and whiskey in a pan first) to the batter and it was really nice. I'd make this one again. It is very sweet but that's how this type of cake is suppose to be!

I've just finished making this for the second time. Awesome recipe!! Follow just as written and don't change a thing! Take it from a southern girl who grew up eating Grandma's pound cake and knows just how it should be. This one really does remind me of hers.

Love this recipe! Used the zest and juice of one lemon in place of the lemon extract - the produces a very lemony pound cake. If not a fan of lemon pound cake, don't add any lemon and increase the vanilla extract to 2 - 3 teaspoons. The pan needs to be very well greased or the cake will stick. Adding a glaze is a wonderful addition. The cake has a bit of a crunchy exterior which is a great contrast to the moist cake.

good, easy recipe; however, following all directions, I was unable to remove the cake from my non-stick, greased bundt cake pan. What a frustration! Finally managed to pry it out of the pan, but left the top layer stuck in the pan. I would advise, grease, flour the pan, heavily before adding batter. I had no lemon extract so used 2 tsp of lemon zest. Nice flavor to eat plain or with added fruit compote/trifle, fresh fruit.
Followed others tip of dusting pan with sugar to give it some crunch
Didn't make any changes. It was a big hit. 8 have to make another one tonight. Oh boy, easy peasy

Nice flavor. Took the 90 mins to bake. I followed suggestion of Karlmale and substituted the lemon extract with the juice and rind of one lemon ,added 1 tsp. Cardamon and made a glaze.
Also added 4ozs. Cream cheese.
Its not completely cooled and a quarter is already gone. Thanks for the recipe Cathy.

Delicious by itself! But usually I prefer to bake this recipe in two large loaf pans so I can make them two different flavors. Lemon is nice and refreshing, but we also love coconut (with coconut extract instead of lemon and some coconut shavings on top) and my favorite, almond (with almond extract instead of lemon, obviously).
